name: Back Hyperextension
description: A controlled spinal extension exercise performed on a hyperextension bench. Primarily targets the lower back (erector spinae), glutes, and hamstrings.
instructions: Position your hips on the pad with feet secured. Lower your torso under control while keeping a neutral spine. Raise your upper body until aligned with your legs. Avoid overextending your lower back.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep spine neutral and avoid hyperextending at the top. Move slowly and avoid jerky motions.

name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
description: A unilateral glute activation exercise performed on the floor. It strengthens the glutes, stabilizers, hamstrings, and improves lumbopelvic control.
instructions: Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended. Press through your heel and lift your hips while keeping your core engaged. Avoid arching your lower back. Lower slowly with control.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Do not overextend hips. Keep ribs down and avoid pushing through lower back. Move slowly.

name: Hanging Leg Raises (Bent-Knee or Single-Leg)
description: A core exercise performed while hanging from a bar. The bent-knee or single-leg variation targets the abdominals and hip flexors while reducing lumbar strain.
instructions: Hang from a bar with shoulders active. Bend your knees and lift them toward your chest while keeping your core braced. Avoid swinging and keep your spine neutral. Lower slowly with control.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Use bent-knee or single-leg only. Avoid straight-leg raises. Keep pelvis neutral and avoid lumbar rounding.

name: One-Arm Crossover Cable Pull
description: A unilateral cable pulling exercise that targets the lats, upper back, and deep stabilizers. This movement also improves core control and supports a healthy spine.
instructions: Stand sideways to the cable machine with the handle set slightly above shoulder level. Grab the handle with the outside arm. Pull the cable across your body while keeping your torso stable and ribs down. Focus on driving the elbow toward the hip. Avoid rotating the spine.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep core braced and avoid twisting the lower back. Use light to moderate weight and move with control.

name: Cable Kickbacks
description: A controlled cable kickback exercise focusing on glutes, hamstrings, spinal stabilizers, and leg biceps. Great for strength without loading the lumbar spine.
instructions: Attach the ankle strap to the cable. Stand tall, brace your core, keep ribs down. Kick the leg backward slowly, avoid leaning forward or arching the back. Return with control.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Do not bend forward. Keep posture upright. Use light resistance and prioritize slow controlled movement.

name: Bird Dog (Bench or Stability Ball)
description: A cable-free core stabilization exercise that strengthens the spine, back muscles, and deep stabilizers with minimal lumbar load.
instructions: On a bench or stability ball, keep pelvis neutral. Extend opposite arm and leg slowly. Avoid shifting hips or arching lower back. Hold 2 seconds, switch sides.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Do not raise leg too high. Keep abdomen braced, ribs down, and move slow for stability.

name: Cable Knee Drive
description: The Cable Knee Drive is a dynamic lower-body exercise that strengthens the hip flexors, challenges the core, and enhances overall stability. With the cable strap secured around the ankle, you lift the knee toward the chest while resisting the pull of the machine. This movement closely resembles sprinting mechanics, making it especially valuable for improving acceleration, jump performance, and explosive leg power. The constant tension also forces the core to stay active, promoting better balance, coordination, and upright posture throughout the exercise.
instructions: Lie on your back, attach foot/handle to cable set at low pull. Brace core, drive one knee toward chest without lumbar rounding. Extend back slowly. Do not swing.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Perform single-leg only. Keep lower back on floor and pelvis neutral. Avoid lumbar rounding. Use light load.

name: Bodyweight/Light Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squats
description: A back-friendly unilateral leg builder that avoids axial spinal loading while still building muscle effectively.
instructions: Place rear foot on bench, step forward, brace core. Lower under control without leaning torso forward aggressively.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep torso upright, avoid deep forward bend. No added weight if pain increases.

name: Leg Extension
description: Quadriceps isolation using a machine with zero compression through the lumbar spine.
instructions: Sit tall, hold handles, extend knees under control. Avoid leaning back aggressively.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Do not slam the pad, keep movement smooth. Reduce range if nerve pain flares.

name: Seated Hip Abduction
description: Glute medius and outer-leg isolation improving hip stability and pelvis control, which supports spine health.
instructions: Sit tall, press knees outward slowly, avoid lumbar movement while spreading.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep pelvis neutral, avoid leaning sideways or arching.

name: Bench or Machine Hip Thrust
description: A glute and hamstring builder with external support that avoids spinal compression and trains hip hinge strength safely.
instructions: Upper back on bench or supported pad, drive hips up without lumbar arch. Ribs down, chin tucked slightly.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: No top-position lumbar arching. Reduce load if compression or nerve pain increases.

name: Belt Squats
description: A squat variation using a dip belt or dedicated belt-squat machine where weight hangs from the hips instead of resting on the shoulders. Removes spinal compression and is ideal for people with lower back concerns, herniated disc history, or shoulder injuries who want to load legs without compressing the spine.
instructions: Stand on the platform with the belt secured around your hips and weight attached. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up. Push through your feet to return to the starting position. The load stays on your pelvis/hips with minimal pressure on the lower back.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep torso upright and avoid excessive forward lean. Load is on pelvis, not spine. Great alternative for those with lumbar pain (L4-L5/L5-S1), herniated discs, or sciatica.
Excellent choice as it removes spinal compression. Weight hangs from hips, not shoulders. Maintain neutral spine throughout the movement.
Minimal pressure on lower back and discs. Keep movements controlled and avoid bouncing at the bottom. Stop if any nerve pain occurs.

name: Deadlift
description: A fundamental compound hip-hinge movement that targets the posterior chain including glutes, hamstrings, erector spinae, and upper back. While highly effective for building strength, proper form and load management are critical for spinal health.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot. Hinge at hips, grip bar just outside legs. Brace core, keep spine neutral, chest up. Drive through heels, extend hips and knees simultaneously. Keep bar close to body. Lower with control by hinging hips first.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Use lighter loads (under 25kg starting weight) and perfect form. Keep spine neutral - no rounding or excessive arching. Stop immediately if pain occurs. Consider trap bar or Romanian deadlift variations.
Requires medical clearance. Use very light loads or avoid. Consider belt squats or hip thrusts instead.

name: Glute Bridge Machine
description: A machine-based or dumbbell-loaded glute bridge exercise that targets glutes and hamstrings with back support. Safer alternative to barbell hip thrusts for those with back concerns.
instructions: Position yourself on the machine or lie on your back with a dumbbell on your hips. Drive through heels to lift hips up, squeezing glutes at the top. Keep ribs down, avoid arching lower back. Lower with control.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep pelvis neutral at top position. Avoid overextending lumbar spine. Focus on glute contraction.

name: Seated Cable Row
description: A horizontal pulling exercise using a cable machine that targets the mid-back, lats, and rear delts. Excellent for building back thickness and improving posture while maintaining a stable, supported position.
instructions: Sit with feet on footrests, knees slightly bent. Grip handle with arms extended. Pull handle to lower abdomen, driving elbows back. Squeeze shoulder blades together. Keep torso upright, avoid rounding or overextending spine. Return with control.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Maintain upright posture throughout. Avoid flexion under load. Use smooth, controlled movements.

name: Chest Fly
description: An isolation exercise for the chest using a fly machine or lying with dumbbells. Targets pectorals with minimal shoulder stress when performed correctly.
instructions: Sit with back against pad, grip handles at chest level. Keep slight bend in elbows. Bring handles together in front of chest using a hugging motion. Control the return. Avoid excessive arching of lower back.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep lower back pressed against pad. Avoid driving through lower back to move weight.

name: Incline Leg Raises
description: A core exercise performed on an incline bench targeting the lower abdominals and hip flexors. The incline adds difficulty compared to flat leg raises.
instructions: Lie on incline bench, grip handles behind head. Keep lower back pressed to bench. Raise legs up toward chest with controlled movement. Lower slowly without letting lower back arch. Keep knees slightly bent if needed.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep lower back pressed to bench. Avoid excessive range that causes lumbar extension. Bend knees if needed.

name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: An overhead pressing exercise performed seated with dumbbells. Targets shoulders (deltoids) and triceps while the seated position provides back support.
instructions: Sit on bench with back support, hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms forward. Press dumbbells overhead until arms are extended but not locked. Lower with control to shoulder level. Keep core engaged, avoid excessive arching of lower back.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Use back support. Avoid excessive arching. Start with lighter weights (3-4kg per dumbbell).

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raises
description: An isolation exercise for the side deltoids (shoulders) that creates shoulder width and definition. Minimal back involvement when performed correctly.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, dumbbells at sides. Keep slight bend in elbows. Raise arms out to sides until parallel with floor, leading with elbows. Lower with control. Avoid swinging or using momentum. Keep torso stable.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Use light weights (2-3kg). Avoid swinging or leaning. Keep torso stable.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curls
description: A fundamental arm exercise targeting the biceps. Can be performed standing or seated with various grips (supinated, hammer, or alternating).
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart or sit on bench. Hold dumbbells with arms extended, palms forward. Curl weights up by bending elbows, keeping upper arms stationary. Squeeze biceps at top. Lower with control. Avoid swinging or using back momentum.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Avoid using momentum or swinging body. Keep core braced and spine neutral.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Kickbacks
description: An isolation exercise for the triceps performed in a hinged position. Targets the back of the arms with minimal shoulder involvement.
instructions: Hinge forward at hips with neutral spine, one hand on bench for support. Hold dumbbell with elbow bent at 90 degrees, upper arm parallel to torso. Extend arm back until fully straightened. Squeeze tricep. Return with control. Avoid swinging or moving upper arm.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Support torso on bench. Keep spine neutral, avoid rounding. Use light weights (2-3kg).

name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
description: A cable exercise targeting the triceps using a high pulley and straight bar, V-bar, or rope attachment. Excellent for building arm strength and definition.
instructions: Stand facing cable machine with high pulley. Grip bar with hands shoulder-width apart, elbows at sides. Push bar down by extending elbows until arms are straight. Keep elbows stationary. Return with control, stopping at 90 degrees. Maintain upright posture.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Stand upright, avoid leaning over bar. Keep core engaged and spine neutral.

name: Floor Crunches
description: A basic core exercise targeting the abdominals while lying on the floor or mat. Safer for the spine than sit-ups due to limited range of motion.
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat on floor. Place hands behind head or across chest. Engage core and lift shoulder blades off floor by curling torso toward knees. Keep lower back on floor. Lower with control. Avoid pulling on neck.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep lower back on floor. Use controlled movements. Avoid jerky motions.

name: Bicycle Crunches
description: A dynamic core exercise that targets the abdominals and obliques through a rotating movement pattern. Excellent for overall core strength and coordination.
instructions: Lie on back, hands behind head, legs lifted with knees bent. Bring right elbow toward left knee while extending right leg. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion. Keep lower back pressed to floor. Move with control, not speed. Focus on rotation from torso, not just arms.

back_issue_restrictions.recommendation: Keep lower back pressed to floor throughout. Slow controlled movements. Stop if any sharp pain.
